hat is not debunking. <BR><BR>Read the groups main page for how Frank descr=

ific, I just take the approach, try different methods, see what works. I go=

at we do".<BR><BR><BR>--- On <B>Mon, 8/23/10, Fransen, Debbie <I><<A hre=

Y>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=3Dtop>I realize you have plenty of subjective anecdotal =
evidence.I don't consider that 'hard evidence' however.  I am looking =
for something a little more objective and less subject to influence and int=
erpretations.<BR><BR>And stop putting words in my mouth. A person can misin=
terpret something, mistake something, or confuse something, without lying a=
bout something.  And before you jump down my throat claiming I am sayi=
ng all results are mistakes, I am not.  I am performing experiments, k=
eeping an open mind, and considering all evidence I find. <BR><BR>The way y=
ou have been attacking me by calling me names at every turn, just because I=
 try new things and don't always agree with your world view, is eerily remi=
niscent of the way the church of old tried to suppress new thought and disc=
overies, except you're just substituting the word 'heretic' with 'science'.=
 and 'blasphemy' with anything that disagrees with you.<BR><BR>There's an o=
ld
 saying:  "We become that which we hate".  So far, all you've =
done is denounce people's efforts to try new methods and see what works.&nb=
sp; You accept nothing anyone else proposes if it does not agree with you.&=
nbsp; That is the realm of the extreme skeptic: the same skeptic you ridicu=
le.<BR> <BR>You certainly don't have to agree with my comments.  =
And I don't have to agree with yours.  But no one needs all the name c=
alling Frank.   It really adds nothing to support your theories.<=
BR><BR><BR><BR>--- On <B>Sun, 8/22/10, Frank Sumption <I><<A href=3D"htt=
p://mc/compose?to=3Dpurplealiengirl@..." target=3D_blank rel=3Dnofoll=
ow>purplealiengirl@...</A>></I></B> wrote:<BR>

D vAlign=3Dtop>I don't think I have enough data yet to make any conclusions=
, so I plan more experiments.  Since there are different distinct clai=
ms about what the box or the recorders can do, I try to make different dist=
inct experiments for each.<BR><BR>Some people claim they can get the box to=
 tell them things that the operator couldn't know, so my "whats the object"=
 experiment is one way to examine that.  Some people claim the boxes c=
an make predictions, so cataloging predictions and examining the results ca=
n help examine that.  If there are other claims, I will try to figure =
experiments based on those.<BR><BR>--- On <B>Sat, 8/21/10, Frank Sumption <=

hey are not omnipresent like God,  probably why David doesn't wan=
t to play the guessing game, he has better things to do over there, and has=

o see what you have over there, He did tell me that first time what it was,=

stand them sometimes, He was also right about that little boy, Syler being
